intro: Trichomanes eriophorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf maidenhair fern, is a delicate fern species belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, linear leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in width. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fronds are usually erect and have a leathery texture, with spores produced on the underside of the leaves. Trichomanes eriophorum is known for its ability to grow on rock surfaces or in crevices, making it a common epiphytic species in humid forests.
